titleStmt.title: National Library of Sweden, A 211
titleStmt.sponsor: Medieval Latin Manuscripts in the National Library: Cataloguing and Digitization
titleStmt.funder: Riksbankens jubileumsfond – The Swedish Foundation for Humanities and Social Sciences

publicationStmt.publisher: manuscripta.se: A Digital Catalogue of Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts in Sweden

msDesc.head: Theological miscellany, written and compiled by Johannes Indaginis

p.note: Pastedowns with text written by the main scribe of the codex, Johannes Indaginis, beginning: In nomine christi ihesu incipit de gradibus humilitatis

supportDesc.foliation: Contemporary foliation in brown ink. Erratic foliation with over 20 leaves lacking foliation (marked with an A) or gaps (e.g. 159 to 170). Many of the leaves lacking foliation are inserted leaves of smaller size. 1-17, 17A, 18, 18A, 19-31, 31bis, 32-36, 36A, 37-40, 40A, 41-42, 42A, 43-75, 78-114, 114A, 115-137, 137A, 138-147, 148-149A supplied foliation, 150-159, 170-188, 188A, 189-260, 260A, 261-293, 293A, 294-356, 356A, 357-366, 366A, 367-375, 378-430, 430A, 431, 431A, 432-434, 434A, 435, 435A, 436-439, 440 modern foliation (the text continues on). Modern foliation in pencil. In nomine domini

binding.p: Medieval binding. Brown leather over wooden boards. 3 double raised bands and endbands. Catchplates on and . On , the Erfurt Charterhouse signum A 38 in white paint. Stamped in gold: A 211 (current signum).

decoNote.p: and : Tooled in blind with double frames and a St Andrew's cross in the centre. Along the sides, fleur-de-lys in lozenge (EBDB s018794); in the inner frame quatrefoil blossom with additional leaves; another fleur-de-lys in lozenge (EBDB s007535) and in the centre a rosette (EBDB s018801). The book-binder may be the Erfurt master Thomasius, active ca 1476-1492.

binding.condition: Leather worn. The covers have been repaired. Traces of insects on and .

acquisition.p: Purchased by the National Library from George Stephens on 23 November .

msItem.title: Table of contents
msItem.rubric: Contenta in hoc volumine
msItem.incipit: Primo exposicio decreti consilii basiliensis
msItem.note: The numbers in red refer to the contemporary foliation.

msItem.title: Theological works
Exposition on two decretals at the council of Basle
msItem.incipit: In nomine domini nostri ihesu christi incipit exposicio super duo decreta sacri concilii basiliensis
msItem.note: The decretals are ‘De excommunicatis non vitandis’ () and ‘De annatis’ (). On a simplified summary.
msItem.colophon: Explicit Erffurdie in Carthusia in vigilia omnium sanctorum anno domini 1459

msItem.title: On the holy trinity
msItem.incipit: In nomine ihesu christi incipit de beatissima trinitate

msItem.title: A summary of exemptions and privileges of the Carthusian order
msItem.rubric: De exempcione ordinis Carthusiensis Clemens vii bonifacius nonus fecerunt exempciones ordinis Carthusiensis ut habetur in bulla exempcionis quam dedit martinus vus
msItem.incipit: Celestinus papa in quodam priuilegio

msItem.title: De consideratione sui
msItem.incipit: In nomine Ihesu Christi incipit de consideracione sui et ad se pertinencium
msItem.note:
The text is also found in British Library MS Add. 15105, fols 103r-104r, see Theele (1920)
.

msItem.title: Modus sancte vivendi
msItem.rubric: In nomine ihesu christi incipit modus sancte viuendi

msItem.note:
The text is also found in British Library MS Add. 15105, fol. 104v, see Theele (1920)
.

msItem.title: De vita Christiana
msItem.rubric: In nomine ihesu christi Incipit de vita christiana
msItem.incipit: Nolite tangere christos meos (Ps. 104:15)
msItem.explicit: et spiritu sancto in secula feliciter seculorum feliciter benedictum Amen
msItem.note:
The text is also found in Trier Stadtbibliothek, MS 1975/642, fols 337va-340ra; see Coulson (1997)
, and British Library MS Add. 15105, fol. 104v, see Theele (1920)
; Mertens (1981)
.

msItem.title: Gnotosolitos
msItem.rubric: In nomine ihesu christi Incipit gnotosolitos id est agnicio sui
msItem.incipit: Hoc prouerbium lapsum est de celo
msItem.explicit: prestante christo ihesu domino nostro benedicto Amen
msItem.note:
This text is also found in Trier Stadtbibliothek, MS 1975/642, fols 340ra-341 vb, see Coulson (1997)
, and British Library MS Add. 15105, fol. 110r, see Theele (1920)
.

msItem.title: On the Virgin Mary
msItem.incipit: In nomine ihesu christi Incipit de beatissima virgine Maria

msItem.incipit: Religiose ac in christi visceribus multum dilecte frater
msItem.explicit: regnante cum deo patre in vnitate spiritus sancti deus per omnia secula seculorum Amen Amen
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus bonus et utilis de perfeccione et exerciciis ordinis Carthusiensis ad perfeccionem ordinatis 1458

msItem.title: On the prior's office in the Carthusian order
msItem.rubric: In nomine Domini nostri ihesu christi Incipit tractatus de officio prioris in ordine Carthusiensi Succurre christe et sancte Ieronime

msItem.explicit: Explicit anno 1465 calixti pape et martiris

msItem.incipit: Videte quid faciatis
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit 1467 prope festum galli confessoris in carthusia prope stettin et cetera

msItem.title: On the confessions of most religious persons
msItem.rubric: In nomine domini nostri ihesu christi Incipit tractatus de confessione maxime religiosorum Succurre christe et sancte Ieronime
msItem.incipit: Ite ostendite vos sacerdotibus verba sunt eterne veritatis
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus de confessione facienda in carthusia prope stettin anno 1465 galli confessoris

msItem.title: On necessary virtues following confession
msItem.rubric: In nomine ihesu christi Incipit tractatus de acquisicione virtutum que necessarie sunt post confessionem succurre christe et sancte Ieronime
msItem.incipit: Dominus virtutum ipse est rex glorie
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit anno 1465 in carthusia prope Stettin calixti pape et cetera

msItem.title: On the vicar's office in the Carthusian order
msItem.rubric: In nomine domini nostri ihesu christi Incipit de officio vicarii in ordine sacro Carthusiensi Succurre christe et sancte Ieronime
msItem.incipit: quorum vicem gerebat
msItem.explicit: Explicit anno 1465 calixti pape et martiris

msItem.title: On the procurator's office in the Carthusian order
msItem.rubric: In nomine domini nostri ihesu christi Incipit tractatus De officio procuratoris in ordine Carthusiensi
msItem.incipit: Vide ministerium quod a domino accepisti
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit in die lamberti episcopi anno 1465

msItem.title: On the sacristan's office
msItem.rubric: Prologus in tractatum de officio sacriste
msItem.incipit: Sacrista quasi sacra arista

msItem.title: On the emendator in the Carthusian order
msItem.rubric: Incipit in nomine ihesu christi tractatus in ordine Carthusiensi de emendatore Succurre christe piissime et Ieronime sanctissime
msItem.incipit: Emendabit me iustus in misericordia

msItem.title: On the cantor's office in the Carthusian order
msItem.rubric: In nomine ihesu christi Incipit de officio cantoris in ordine Carthusiensi. Succurre christe et sanctissime Ieronime
msItem.incipit: Cantate domino canticum nouum (Ps. 97)
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit anno 1465 in profesto Luce euangeliste

msItem.title: On the infirmarian's office in the Carthusian order
msItem.rubric: In nomine ihesu incipit de officio infirmarii in ordine Carthusiensi Succurre Christe virginitas marie et sanctissime Ieronime
msItem.incipit: Infirmus fui et visitastis me (Matt. 25:36)

msItem.title: On the priest's office in the Carthusian order
msItem.rubric: De officio sacerdotis in ordine Carthusiensis Incipit in nomine Ihesu succurre christe et sanctissime Ieronime cum Maria virgine
msItem.incipit: Tu es sacerdos in eternum secundum ordinem melchisedech (Ps. 109)

msItem.title: On those who do not celebrate communion in the Carthusian order
msItem.incipit: Incipit in nomine domini nostri Ihesu christi de communione non celebrancium in ordine Carthusiensi
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit anno 1464 in carthusia prope Stettin

msItem.title: On the instruction of novices in the Carthusian order
msItem.incipit: In nomine domini nostri ihesu christi Incipit de informacione noviciorum in ordine Carthusiensi
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit anno 1465 prope Stettin in carthusia

msItem.title: On doubts regarding most religious persons in the Carthusian order
msItem.rubric: In nomine ihesu christi Incipit declaracio quorundam dubiorum de religiosis maxime in sacro nostro ordine Carthusiensi
msItem.incipit: Succurre Christe cum beatissime matre virgine ac sanctis omnibus
msItem.note:
Metzger (2008)
notes that, in his description of the manuscript, Lehmann (1935) does not record the contents on . In the medieval register of Salvatorberg charterhouse library, the following questions by Johannes Indaginis
are recorded in manuscript A.38, possibly found in this section: Utrum possit dare licentiam intrandi ad moniales; An quis putans se non idoneum tenetur consentire in suam electionem; Quid sentiendum de pauperibus, qui non sunt in solvendo sine sua culpa, an debeant gravari; An monachi possint accipere precarias, que dantur ultra debitum censum; De cupiditate emendi temporalia; An religiosi possint peccata sua occultare; An liceat religiosis habere dominia temporalia et justiciarios, advocatos et judicum sanguinis; De vitando scandalo; De emendatione; De periculis religiosorum in temporalibus; An exempti possint ab aliis judicibus judicari et an illis subiaceant; An aliquis possit laudare seipsum.

msItem.title: Dialogue regarding resignation from pastoral care
msItem.rubric: Dyalogus de resignacione cure pastoralis
msItem.incipit: In nomine domini nostri Jhesu Incipit dyalogus Inter patrem interrogantem et filium respondentem super quibusdam questionibus et dubiis
msItem.finalRubric: Hec scripta sunt erffordie et circa Conuentum ibidem, ut elici potest folio 338 etc

msItem.title: A sermon on the Body of Christ
msItem.rubric: In nomine Domini nostri ihesu christi Incipit sermo de corpore Cristi
msItem.incipit: Memoriam fecit mirabilium suorum
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit in carthusia prope franckenforde anno 1461 in die dionisii ac sociorum eius

msItem.title: A sermon on the Body of Christ
msItem.rubric: In nomine christi ihesu de corpore eiusdem incipit Reuela oculos meos et considerabo mirabilia de lege tua psalmo 118
msItem.incipit: In christo carissimi

msItem.title: A sermon on the Body of Christ
msItem.rubric: In nomine domini nostri ihesu christi Incipit sermo de corpore Cristi
msItem.incipit: Rogo vos accipere cibum (Acts 27:34)
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit in carthusia prope franckenforde anno 1464 die LXXe

msItem.title: On the paying of debts
msItem.incipit: Reddite ergo quo sunt cesaris cesari et qui sunt dei deo (Matt. 22:21)
msItem.explicit: quoniam est dominus benedictus in secula

msItem.title: On the dedication of a church
msItem.incipit: In nomine ihesu christi Incipit in dedicacione ecclesie
msItem.explicit: qui est dominus benedictus in secula

msItem.title: On preaching in the Carthusian order
msItem.incipit: In nomine domine ihesu christi Incipit tractatus de predicatore, precipue in ordine carthusiensi
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit anno 1465 Calixti pape in carthusia prope stettin

msItem.title: An apology for brother Johannes Indaginis directed to the Carthusian Prior of Liegnitz
msItem.incipit: Venerabili ex christo patri priori carthusie legenitzensi scripsi hunc breuem tractatum quasi appologeticum

msItem.title: A tractate on holy virgins
msItem.incipit: In nomine ihesu christi Incipit tractatus de virginibus sacris Despondi uos vni uiro

p.note: Unidentified watermarks throughout the volume, mostly partially visible towards .

supportDesc.condition: , : stains. Remnants of dried plant material has occasionally been placed in the gutters.

handDesc.handNote: Hybrida (Johannes Indaginis) with unlooped l:s, h;s and d:s.
Hybrida with looped l:s; unlooped d:s and b:s, rotund r:s.

Hybrida with unlooped l:s, unlooped d:s and b:s. The scribe is Jacob Paleman
of Erfurt Charterhouse, according to a note on .

p.note: Upper left corner, in brown ink by a modern hand: Inköpt till Kongl. Bibl. från G. Stephens 23/11 1848.
Marginal notes in brown and red ink, in most cases by the main scribe (Johannes Indaginis).
Upper left corner, in brown ink by an early modern hand: Cartusiae Erfordiensis
Paper slips with notes in brown ink by Johannes Indaginis.
Paper note with a text in brown ink by a modern hand: H (...) Tractat de prima et secunda parte Statutorum. (...) De Priuilegijs Ordinis.
Inserted note with annotations byJohannes Indaginis in brown ink.
Right margin, in brown ink by a medieval hand (Hand 1; the scribe Johannes Indaginis), 15 lines of marginal notes beginning: Jo. Indaginis Carthusiensis collegit hec. Oretur pro eo
Bottom of page, in brown ink by a medieval hand: Ad carthusienses prope erffordiam
Top of page, in dark brown ink by Johannes Indagini hunc tractatum scripsi in ysnacho ad peticionem fratris henrici dasle donati domus hildensis, baccalaurei formati in theologia

Right margin, in in dark brown ink by Johannes Indaginis: Per manus Jacobi Paleman, professi domus Erffordiensis. Below the final rubric: hic tractatus pertinet ad domum Erffordensem sed dictatus in Ysnacho. Below, in lighter brown ink, 13 lines of text starting: Nota septem gradus humilitatis ponit sanctus Anselmus archiepiscopus Cantuariensis in libro de similitudinibus primus Contemptibilem se cognoscere
Loose paper note (ca 100 x 45 mm), with the following text in brown ink by an early modern hand: Joanni ab Indagine (...) antiqua statuta et annexa (...) H. II. regl. 2 (...).
In black ink by an early modern hand: B. Hic fuit visitator provincie Saxonie
Upper left margin, in brown ink by a medieval scribe: manicule.

decoDesc.p: Main text in brown ink. Rubrics in red on .

decoNote.p: : Plain initial Q in red ink over 2 lines. : Plan initial V in red ink over 3 lines, with interior reserved shapes. (pen-flourishing?) : Plain initial A in red ink over 2 lines. : Capitals touched in red.
Bookmark in pink leather on ; ; in parchment on , , , , , , , ; remnants of a bookmark on , ; bookmark in brown leather .

handDesc.handNote: Hybrida with unlooped l:s and b:s, single-compartment a:s, looped and unlooped d:s.

p.note: Middle of page, in brown ink by Johannes Indaginis: anno 1474 scripsi hoc
Inserted note with annotations by Johannes Indaginis in brown ink.
Inserted note with contemporary annotations in brown ink.
